name: Multi-Switch
description: This algorithm offers up to six highly configurable sequential or voltage-controlled switches that are DC-coupled and can handle both audio and CV signals. Each switch consists of two sub-switches: an input sub-switch and an output sub-switch, where the selected input is routed to the selected output. When multiple switches share the same output bus, their signals are summed. Both sub-switches support crossfading for click-free or blended transitions between sources/targets. The switches can be controlled via CV inputs or through 'Macro' parameters, which can themselves be mapped to various control sources like CV, MIDI, or I2C.
use_cases: Audio signal routing between multiple inputs and outputs
CV signal switching for modular synthesis
Sequencer step control via triggers or voltage
Macro parameter-based switching for complex patching
Signal summation from multiple switches sharing an output
gui_description: The display shows which input and output busses are currently joined by the various switches.

specifications.name: Number of Switches
specifications.description: Supports configurable switching between 1 to 6 individual units.

specifications.name: DC Coupling
specifications.description: Allows for seamless routing of both audio and CV signals.

input_ports.name: Input A-L (1-12)
input_ports.description: The input busses for the switches, labeled from A to L. Each switch can select one of these inputs.

input_ports.name: CV Inputs
input_ports.description: Voltage-controlled inputs that can trigger or directly control switch positions.

output_ports.name: Output A-H (1-8)
output_ports.description: The output busses for the switches, labeled from A to H. Each switch can select one of these outputs.

output_ports.name: Summed Outputs
output_ports.description: When multiple switches share an output bus, their signals are summed and sent through that single output.
